pageContent:
City Zoo - Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What are the general hours of operation?
A: Open daily 9:00 AM–5:00 PM. Last entry 4:30 PM. Seasonal hours apply June–August: 9:00 AM–6:00 PM, last entry 5:30 PM.

Q: When are seasonal (summer) hours in effect?
A: June 1 through August 31. During this period, hours are 9:00 AM–6:00 PM with last entry at 5:30 PM.

Q: Do you close for weather?

Q: Do you close for weather?
A: We remain open in light rain. Severe weather (e.g., lightning, high winds) may cause temporary closures. Check website alerts or SMS updates on the day of your visit.

Q: Is outside food allowed?
A: Yes. Personal food and non-alcoholic drinks are allowed. Glass containers and alcohol are not permitted. Picnic areas are available near the North Lawn.

Q: Are picnic baskets or coolers allowed?

Q: Are picnic baskets or coolers allowed?
A: Small soft-sided coolers are allowed. Hard-sided coolers larger than 24 L are not permitted. All items are subject to inspection at entry.

Q: Can I bring water bottles?
A: Yes. Refillable bottles are encouraged; refill stations are located near the main plaza and North Lawn.

Q: Are there restaurants or concessions on site?
A: Yes. Concessions operate daily from 10:30 AM. Hours may vary in off-peak seasons.

Q: Do you accept digital tickets?
A: Yes. Show the barcode on your phone for faster entry.

Q: Do you rent strollers or wheelchairs?
A: Yes. Rentals are available at the main gate while supplies last.

Q: Are service animals allowed?
A: Trained service animals are welcome. Emotional support animals are not permitted.

Q: May I smoke or vape?
A: No. The zoo is a smoke-free and vape-free campus.

Q: Is photography allowed?

Q: Is photography allowed?
A: Personal photography is welcome. Tripods and commercial shoots require prior approval.

Q: How can I contact Guest Services?
A: Visit the desk at the main gate during operating hours or call 555-123-4567.

City Zoo — Food & Retail

Outside Food:
- Outside food and non-alcoholic drinks are permitted.
- Glass containers, alcohol, and open flames are prohibited.

Picnic Areas:
- Picnic areas are located near the North Lawn and the Children’s Zone.

Concessions:
- Concessions include burgers, pizza, salads, and vegetarian options.
- Concessions operate daily from 10:30 AM; hours vary in off-peak seasons.

Retail:

Retail:
- The gift shop is located near the exit. It sells toys, apparel, and eco-friendly souvenirs.
- Members receive 10% off all retail purchases.

City Zoo — Memberships

Benefits:
- Unlimited general admission for one year.
- Discounts on concessions and retail (10%).
- Early access to special events.

Guest Passes:
- Some tiers include guest passes. These are valid for general admission only.
- Blackout dates may apply during high-demand days (e.g., long weekends).

Renewals:
- Memberships can be renewed online or at Guest Services.
- Renewal reminders are sent 30 days before expiration.

Blackout Dates:

Blackout Dates:
- Blackout dates are posted on the zoo’s website calendar each season.

City Zoo — Safety & Weather Policy

Weather:
- The zoo remains open in light rain.
- Severe weather (lightning, high winds, ice) may cause temporary closures.
- Updates are posted on the website and social channels.

Prohibited Items:
- Weapons, alcohol, glass containers, drones, bicycles on pathways.
- Bags may be inspected at entry.

Animals:
- Feeding animals is not permitted.
- Stay on pathways; climbing fences is prohibited.

Smoking:

Smoking:
- The zoo is a smoke-free and vape-free campus.

Emergency:
- In case of emergency, follow staff instructions and proceed to designated safe zones.

City Zoo - Ticketing & Entry Policy

Entry Windows:
- Standard entry windows are 30 minutes. Late arrivals may be accommodated at staff discretion based on capacity.

Rescheduling:
- One complimentary reschedule up to 24 hours before original entry time (subject to availability).
- Within 24 hours, rescheduling is not guaranteed and may incur a fee.

Refunds:
- Nonrefundable except for full-day closures initiated by the zoo.
- Partial-day weather holds may qualify for rain checks.

Identification:
- Photo ID may be requested for discounted tickets and memberships.

Re-entry:
- Same-day re-entry allowed with hand stamp and valid barcode.

Special Events:
- Separate tickets may be required for after-hours or limited-capacity events.

City Zoo — Visiting Guide

Map:
- A digital map is available on the website and at the main entrance via QR code.

Parking:
- Onsite parking is $10 per vehicle. The overflow lot opens on weekends and holidays.
- Four EV charging stations are available in Row C.

Accessibility:
- Most paths are paved and wheelchair accessible.
- Wheelchair rentals are available at the main gate.
- Family restrooms and nursing areas are located near the Children’s Zone.

Lockers:

Lockers:
- Day-use lockers are available near the main entrance.

Lost & Found:
- Visit Guest Services or call the number on your ticket confirmation.

City Zoo Visitor Guide

Hours:
- Open daily 9:00 AM – 5:00 PM. Last entry 4:30 PM.
- Summer hours (June–August): 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, last entry 5:30 PM.

Tickets:
- Adult (13+): $25, Child (3–12): $15, Under 3: Free.
- Family Pass includes 2 adults + 2 children.
- Online tickets include a barcode for faster entry.

Food & Drinks:
- Outside food is allowed except glass containers and alcohol.
- Picnic areas available near the North Lawn.

Parking:

Parking:
- Onsite parking is $10 per vehicle.
- Overflow lot opens on weekends and holidays.

Accessibility:
- Wheelchair rentals available at the main gate.
- Most paths are paved and accessible.

Weather Policy:
- The zoo remains open in light rain. Severe weather may cause temporary closures. Check alerts on the website.

Contact:
- Guest Services: 555-123-4567
